scenario0.author: abdullah
scenario0.description:
Georgia Tech would like to make changes to the physical layout
of the campus in order to facilitate an easier campus for those
in need. Georgia Tech needs help in identifying places on campus that
need physical changes. Help them identify and pinpoint specific places that
could benefit from these changes.
prompts:
Georgia Tech would like to make changes to the physical layout
of the Georgia Tech campus in order to facilitate an easier campus for those
in need. Georgia Tech needs help in identifying places on campus that
need physical changes. Which places on campus require changes? Enter the 
name of a building/walkway/etc in the text box below and annotate the image
below for larger areas.
scenario0.title: Georgia Tech Disability Services

scenario1.author: abdullah
scenario1.description: Enter this scenario to upload an image of a location on campus that you think requires a physical change <need a better description here lol>
prompts: Please enter a title and description of the post. Click the Browse button to upload an image. Need a better prompt here too lol
scenario1.title: Contribute to the GT Disability Services

scenario2.author: hayley
scenario2.description: Sarah has received lots of texts from an unknown number recently. Help her figure out who is stalking her!
prompts: Sarah has received lots of texts from an unknown number recently. Based on the pictures below, answer these questions and annotate the picture to support your hypothesis:  When and where is the event happening? Characteristics of the anonymous message sender? (e.g. age, gender, ethnicity, academic background)  Why is the person texting the girl? What’s your current hypothesis about who’s the anonymous messenger?

One day she was talking to Girl B and Girl C, Girl B said “Maybe someone has a crush on you and is planning a surprise.”  Girl C disagreed on that, “This is creepy! Seems like someone’s stalking you.” Girl B then said “Don’t be paranoid. Maybe it’s the TA who likes you!” “I wish it’s not a nerd like the TA.” said Sarah.  Around what time was this photo taken? (e.g. season, time of the day?) Do you think the person sending the texts is in the scene? Why? Who do you agree with more? Girl B or Girl C? Why? Who’s the guy passing by and why? What do you think people’s emotions are? What’s your current hypothesis?

Sarah rushed into the restroom before class started. While sitting on the toilet, Sarah received another text. She then noticed someone was standing outside through the stall gap.  Where was this photo taken and what you see in this setting? What clothing items do you notice? (e.g. shoes)  What characteristics would describe a person wearing this? What’s the relationship between the sender and Sarah/ Girl B? What’s your current hypothesis?

Sarah freaked out and was too afraid to get out. Then she heard a shocking voice saying “What are you doing here hun?” by a cleaning staff walked in. The stalker awkwardly fled and Sarah was then able to get out. When she walked out of the restroom, she saw some people, including Girl B, chatting together. Sarah felt that the stalker maybe was among them.  Why do you think the cleaning staff said that? Where and when was this picture taken? What kind of clothing is each person wearing? Do you think there’s more than one stalker? Why? Who is likely to be the stalker?
scenario2.title: Who's stalking the girl?

scenario3.author: chia
scenario3.description: When Mr. Potter got back to work, he saw people standing by his desk, with his secretary sobbing and looking terrified. Help the detective find the culprit!
prompts: Mr. Potter left the office early but returned later because he had left his phone. When he got back to office, he saw his secretary sobbing and looking terrified. “Mr. Potter! Someone broke into your computer. I went to the breakroom for only a few minutes and when I returned I realized the important file on the desktop was deleted! Shall we call the police?” When and where was this photo taken?  Who do you see in this scene and what are their characteristics? What do you think happened here? What were everyone’s emotional reactions to the event? What’s your current hypothesis about who stole the file?

Mr. Potter called the police. The secretary explained the whole thing and the police took a look at the office. It was a small space, and there were no windows, just a door connected to two other person’s office - Mr. Poole and Ms. Walker.  Why do you think the police questioned the secretary? What do you think the secretary will explain? Do you think the police believes her? What are these paper scraps on the floor? Are they significant clues？ What’s your current hypothesis?

The police decided to ask Ms. Walker a few questions. “What were you doing at that time?” “I was pretty busy this evening officer. We got an important meeting next week. I was just working on my laptop trying to get the data ready, also was scanning some documents. I think I heard some sound in Mr. Potter’s office but I’m not entirely sure.” Ms. Walker said.   Where is she and what is she doing? What do you notice she is carrying or wearing? How would you describe her emotion? What kind of clues does she portray about her testimony? What’s your current hypothesis?

The police then questioned Mr. Poole. “Uh... Hmm well, I was leading an office tour I think? There’s an important group of company partners visiting us. Oh, and what happened to him doesn’t matter anyway because next week I’ll be the one that gets that promotion.” said Mr. Poole.   What do you notice he is carrying or wearing? How would you describe his emotion? What kind of clues does he portray about his honesty and testimony? What do you think the relationships are between people in this picture? What’s your current hypothesis?

The police turned to the secretary again and pulled up a photo of her in Mr. Potter’s office taken by a security camera earlier that day. “What were you doing?” “I don’t remember exactly...” she said, “but I do all kinds of errands with Mr. Potter’s paperwork, so this afternoon I was probably dropping off some forms for his to sign tomorrow.” What do you notice she is carrying or wearing? What is she doing? Who might she be talking to? How would you describe her emotion? What kind of clues does she portray about her honesty and testimony? Who do you think stole the files? Mr. Poole, Ms. Walker, or the secretary? Why?
scenario3.title: Who stole the secret file?
